title: Question 23
prompt: Which of the following is a logical argument, based on the law of supply and demand?
description:
Click the one best answer to each question.

According to the economic law of supply and demand, at higher prices, people want (or demand) lower quantities. At higher prices, businesses want to make (supply) larger quantities. The equilibrium point, where supply and demand meet, gives the price the item should sell for on an open market.
feedback: If prices decrease, and the product is more expensive, fewer people will want to buy the product. Product sales will likely increase. The chart shows demand going up as prices go down, an illustration that product sales will likely increase.
